thread.title: Prep Sports Roundup 10/1/15: Hannibal softball uses 10-run burst to secure victory
thread.title_full: Prep Sports Roundup 10/1/15: Hannibal softball uses 10-run burst to secure victory

author: Joe Alberico
title: Prep Sports Roundup 10/1/15: Hannibal softball uses 10-run burst to secure victory
text: Posted Oct. 2, 2015 at 12:01 AM Nothing like 10 runs to finish a game. That's exactly how many the Hannibal High School softball team scored Thursday, posting the 10-spot in the fifth inning to cruise past host Rock Bridge 13-3 in a mercy-rule contest in Columbia. The Lady Pirates (9-12) totaled 15 hits behind senior starting pitcher Rachel Halterman. Halterman went all five frames, allowing just one earned run on four hits with three strikeouts and a walk. She also added two hits and drove in a pair of runs. Olivia Pfeifer went 3 for 4 at the plate with two runs scored and one driven in. Tori Moore added three hits, two runs and two RBI. Haley Bautch had a team-high four RBI on with two hits, and Kennedy McKay went 2 for 3 with a run and two RBI. Hannibal boys soccer falls short to Boonville: The Hannibal High School boys soccer team was unable to complete its rally against visiting Boonville on Thursday, falling 3-2 in the North Central Missouri Conference matchup. “We looked tired,” Hannibal head coach Eric Hill said. “We just looked off. Part of that is Boonville, they're a pretty tough team. But I definitely don't think we played our best.” Boonville took a 2-0 first half lead on goals from Alec Adair and Philip Udinyiwe. Hannibal (10-6, 4-3), answered in the 48th minute in the second half on an unassisted goal from Caleb Ketsenburg. Adair pushed Boonville's advantage to 3-1 later in the second half, and Hannibal senior Jack Baumann finished the scoring with a goal on a penalty kick in the 78th minute. The Hannibal junior varsity played to a 0-0 tie and is now 2-3-2 on the year. Palmyra softball shut out at home: The Palmyra High School softball team suffered a 7-0 loss to Clarence Cannon Conference foe Centralia on Thursday in Palmyra. The Lady Panthers fell to 7-15 overall and 3-7 in the CCC. Haleigh Wosman's single accounted for PHS' lone hit of the game. Shelby Cunning ham went seven innings for the Lady Panthers, allowing five earned runs on eight hits with eight strikeouts and two walks.
